Interface TurnListener

All Superinterfaces:
EventListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
LogPanel, OpponentPiecesPanel, TurnAdapter
public interface TurnListener extends EventListener
The listener interface for receiving "interesting" turn events (begin, and end) during a game. The class that is interested in processing a turn event either implements this interface (and all the methods it contains) or extends the abstract TurnAdapter class (overriding only the methods of interest).

The listener object created from that class is then registered in a Strategy's Strategy.register(Game) on the Game object using Game.addTurnListener(TurnListener). Please, do not forget to unregister the listener when the Strategy's Strategy.unregister(Game) method is called by using Game.removeTurnListener(TurnListener) on the Game object. A turn event is generated when a player has to play, and has played. When a turn event occurs, the relevant method in the listener object is invoked, and the TurnEvent is passed to it.

Author:
Belegkarnil
